author: hikariws
content: is it possible to run L2 nodes as it is for main blockchain networks? or are L2 blocks generated by a centralized server?

author: potuz
content: This varies from l2 network to l2 network. You can currently run nodes from a few of them, mostly in testnets. One way of centralization is to have a single sequencer dictating who can propose blocks.

author: hikariws
content: so, L2 is in general a network more centralized than L1, but that also uses blockchain to store the data?

author: hikariws
content: sidechains are independent and just have atomic swap with mainchain, while rollups eventually submit their transactions  to mainchain, when those transactions become definitive?

author: hikariws
content: rollups are more centralized than L1, but are more transparent than off-chain centralized services because their transactions are public to be validated?
